bossam.app
Interface IReasoner

public interface IReasoner

Programs can create and control Bossam rule engine instances using IReasoner interface. The interface provides methods for loading rulebases and OWL ontologies, adding new facts and rules, running inference sessions, and querying.

Since:
2005. 3. 28.
Version:
$Id: IReasoner.html,v 1.3 2007/01/24 08:49:29 zebehn Exp $
Author:
ZEBEHN

ATOML

static final byte ATOML
A conclusion serialization format code to indicate ATOML, a simple fact serialization markup language. ATOML cannot be used to indicate the knowledge base format.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT

static final byte DEFAULT
A conclusion serialization format code to indicate buchingae language. Can also be used to indicate knowledge base format.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

static final byte N3
A knowledge base format code to indicate N3. OWL cannot be used for a conclusion serialization format code.

Constant Field Values

A knowledge base format code to indicate OWL. OWL cannot be used for a conclusion serialization format code.

Method Detail

addObject

void addObject(java.lang.Object obj)
Adds an object into the inference context of this reasoner. Objects in the inference context are accessible through the procedural attachment scheme of Bossam.

Parameters:
obj - an object to be added

addListener

void addListener(bossam.app.IReasonerListener listener)
Adds a listener to this reasoner.

Parameters:
listener -

removeListener

void removeListener(bossam.app.IReasonerListener listener)
Removes a listener from this reasoner.

Parameters:
listener -

ask

java.lang.String ask(java.lang.String query)
Throws a query to this reasoner instance and gets a response. The response is a structured string that represents the bindings to the variables in the query. The query should be in the following format: 
 'query' query_id 'is' antecedent_part_of_rule ';'
antecedent_part_of_rule indicates sentences that can come at the antecedent part of rules. Some sample queries follow:
  • query q is http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?x,?y) and http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?y,?z);
  • query q is http://family.com/family#age(?p,?age) and [?age > 30];
  • query q is http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?x,?y) or http://family.com/family#motherOf(?x,?y)

Parameters:
query - the query to be answered
Returns:
a string containing the bindings to the variables if the query is true with bindings, true if the query is true with no bindings, false if the query is false.

ask1

Answer ask1(java.lang.String query)
Gets an answer to the query. The query should be in the following format: 
 'query' query_id 'is' antecedent_part_of_rule ';'
antecedent_part_of_rule indicates sentences that can come at the antecedent part of rules. Some sample queries follow:
  • query q is http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?x,?y) and http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?y,?z);
  • query q is http://family.com/family#age(?p,?age) and [?age > 30];
  • query q is http://family.com/family#fatherOf(?x,?y) or http://family.com/family#motherOf(?x,?y)

Parameters:
query - the query string
Returns:
a nonempty Answer object that contains all the bindings if there're bindings to the query, an empty Answer object if there's no bindings but the query is true, null if the query is false.

forget

void forget()
Forgets all the facts - those that were explicitly told and those that were derived. Only rules are preserved. NOTE: incomplete implementation yet...

getFacts

java.util.List getFacts()
Gets the list of facts in the working memory.

the list of facts. Each item is a serialzed string of a fact.

a list of rules. Each item is a serialzed string of a rule.

load

void load(int flag,
          java.io.Reader reader,
          java.lang.String baseNsUri)
Loads a knowledge base from a URI. The value of flag can be one of the following:
  • IReasoner.DEFAULT: to read in a rulebase written in Buchingae
  • IReasoner.RULEML: to read in a rulebase written in RuleML
  • IReasoner.SWRL: to read in a rulebase written in SWRL/OWLX
  • IReasoner.SWRLRDF: to read in rules & ontologies written in SWRL/RDF
  • IReasoner.OWL: to read in an RDFS or OWL document written in RDF/XML
  • IReasoner.N3: to read in an RDFS or OWL document written in N3

Parameters:
flag - the format flag number
reader - the reader from where a rulebase will be read

load

void load(int flag,
          java.lang.String uri)
Loads a knowledge base from a URI.
  • IReasoner.DEFAULT: to read in a rulebase written in Buchingae
  • IReasoner.RULEML: to read in a rulebase written in RuleML
  • IReasoner.SWRL: to read in a rulebase written in SWRL/OWLX
  • IReasoner.SWRLRDF: to read in rules & ontologies written in SWRL/RDF
  • IReasoner.OWL: to read in an RDFS or OWL document written in RDF/XML
  • IReasoner.N3: to read in an RDFS or OWL document written in N3

Parameters:
flag - the format flag number
uri - the URI from where a rulebase will be read

run

java.lang.String run()
                     throws etri.bossam.InconsistencyException
Runs a forward-chained inference session.

Returns:
a list of conclusions, or an empty string if nothing can be concluded
Throws:
etri.bossam.InconsistencyException - throws if some inconsistency occurs inside the knowledge base

silentRun

void silentRun()
               throws etri.bossam.InconsistencyException
Runs a forward-chained inference session without conclusions serialized and returned.

Throws:
etri.bossam.InconsistencyException - throws if some inconsistency occurs inside the knowledge base

setBaseNamespace

void setBaseNamespace(java.lang.String baseNamespace)
Sets the base namespace. The base namespace is prepended to all the knowledge elements that are not qualified.

Parameters:
baseNamespace - the namespace URI

setNamespacePrefix

void setNamespacePrefix(java.lang.String prefix,
                        java.lang.String uri)
Adds a namespace prefix.

Parameters:
prefix - a namespace prefix
uri - the full URI of a namespace

setSerializationMode

void setSerializationMode(byte mode)
Sets which format to use for conclusion serialization. There are four formats available:
  • IReasoner.DEFAULT: Conclusions are serialized in Buchingae.
  • IReasoner.ATOML: Conclusions are serialized in a simple markup language.
  • IReasoner.RULEML: Conclusions are serialized in RuleML.

Parameters:
mode - a byte value for indicating the serialization format

tell

void tell(java.util.List facts)
          throws bossam.app.ReasonerException
Tells a list of facts. Each fact in the list should be a string of Buchingae sentences.

Parameters:
facts - a list of facts
Throws:
bossam.app.ReasonerException

tell

void tell(java.lang.String something)
          throws bossam.app.ReasonerException
Tells a new fact or rule. This method accepts a Buchingae sentence. Some example usages are:
  • tell("fact f1 is father(A,B);");
  • tell("rule r1 is if father(?x,?y) and father(?y,?z) then gfather(?x,?z);");
  • tell("individual i1 is Person and name = "john doe";);

Parameters:
something - a Buchingae sentence
Throws:
bossam.app.ReasonerException

turnOffOwlImports

void turnOffOwlImports()
Turns off owl:imports.

turnOnOwlImports

void turnOnOwlImports()
Turns on owl:imports so that imported ontologies are extracted and added to the working memory of this reasoner.
